meanings.definition: A large gulp or swallow of a drink.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, he took a big swig of water from his bottle.
meanings.sent2: She finished the race and then took a refreshing swig of lemonade.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty puppy eagerly lapped up the swig of milk.
meanings.sent4: The exhausted runner felt the cool swig of water revive him.
meanings.sent5: The hot day called for a long, satisfying swig of iced tea.

meanings.sent1: He would swig his soda quickly whenever he was nervous.
meanings.sent2: The kids would swig their juice before heading out to play.
meanings.sent3: She would swig her coffee before starting her workday.
meanings.sent4: The man would swig his beer while watching the game.
meanings.sent5: The hiker would swig his water to quench his thirst on the trail.

meanings.definition: A quantity of liquid, especially an alcoholic drink, taken in a single swallow.
meanings.sent1: At the party, he downed a swig of whiskey in one go.
meanings.sent2: She passed around a swig of rum to celebrate the occasion.
meanings.sent3: The pirate took a swig of grog before setting sail.
meanings.sent4: The toast ended with a swig of champagne for good luck.
meanings.sent5: The daredevil finished the challenge with a daring swig of tequila.
